title: Chapecoense plane crash hero Johan Alexis Ramirez meets Real Madrid stars
text:
Sport Chapecoense plane crash hero Johan Alexis Ramirez meets Real Madrid stars He has been rewarded for helping save six lives by meeting the likes of Zinedine Zidane and James Rodriguez Share Get Real Madrid CF     
The Chapecoense plane crash boy has travelled to Spain to meet his Real Madrid heroes 
Johan Alexis Ramirez, who is dubbed Angel boy, guided rescuers to the crashed plane carrying Chapecoense players last November. 
The 15-year-old saved six lives by sending emergency services to the crash site in Colombia. 
He was invited to a Real training session where he received a signed shirt from compatriot James Rodrigu ez and got selfies with the likes of Zinedine Zidane and Gareth Bale. Ramirez posing with Real Madrid players (Photo: REAL MADRID) Ramirez with James Rodriguez and his signed shirt (Photo: REAL MADRID) The Angel Boy with Real boss Zinedine Zidane (Photo: REAL MADRID) Read More Young boy who helped save six lives in aftermath of Chapecoense air crash rewarded with new home 
Ramirez also watch his favourite team beat Espanyol 2-0 at the weekend. 
Ramirez said: "James represents all Colombians. Itâ€™s very emotional and something very nice for me. This shirt is a very nice gift that I will have for a lifetime, it's a pleasure for me." 
The crash killed 71 people, including players and journalists, as Chapecoense travelled to their Copa Sudamericana Final against Atletico Nacional. 
Ramirez had already been gifted a new house which was painted in the Brazilian side's green colour.
